intro: Catesbaea campanulata, commonly known as the yellow starcluster, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has simple, opposite leaves. It produces small, red berries that are edible for some bird species. Catesbaea campanulata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
